content: ...I hate this games at times when I can't pass a level but none the less a fun game

This game has its moments of fun, if you can force yourself through the rest of its problems.  After you pay, you get to enjoy an in game advertisement at start up.  Not only that, but you can get "reinforcements" by paying for them.  This is the first game I've seen where you have to pay to play, get advertisements, and have to make in game purchases to win.  There is literally a level where you lose the first turn unless you purchase reinforcements.  Get real.  I see that the developers comment every time someone complains about the in app purchases, saying they are there to make it easier, but in some cases, they are there just to make the game winnable.  Also, it freezes up about every minute.  The freezes last anywhere from 15 seconds to 2 minutes.  If it happens to freeze while the AI is doing their turn, you might as well just restart your phone.  What a joke; I won't buy anything from these developers ever again.

content: Overall a solid strategy game-- great maps, scenarios, and campaigns.  War strategy games are hard to come by for Android and well-made games like this, less so.  They amped up the challenge a bit in this sequel.  That's not always a bad thing but at a certain point here I think they went too far-- specifically the scenario from the World War III campaign where you as the Soviets have to take Chicago & Detroit.  I tried several times before finally giving up, but you just have too few troops and too little time to work with.  I know others say they've won on all the maps without purchasing additional resources, but I just don't see how.  I'd love for someone to prove me wrong in a walkthrough.  I much prefer the model of paying more for a game up front and having more permanent balance of difficulty over this one where you need to buy resources to get some temporary balance.  In the latter, I refuse to essentially throw money out the window-- especially given how I like to replay scenarios.  So to sum up, the game is really well executed in most ways, but suffers from the model..  Would love to give it 5 stars but have to go with 3.
replyContent: Thank you, Shayne! Nice and so detailed review. You know, you can ask your questions about this mission at strategy.herocraft.com.

content: Very much worth the pay for price just from all the missions you get plus on and offline multiplayer and its fun too. One of the best there is.   Thank you making this fun, interesting and good quality game.   Bye.
Risk, with tech trees! Just what is required for a total war fan on the move. A modern add-on maybe?

Would give this 5 stars but the game is frustratingly difficult and you ask way too much for simple research points. Between that and it critically freezing my LG Optimus F7, I am disappointed I cannot currently rate this game at 5 stars, because it's quite good.
replyContent: Bryan, we apologise for this problem with the game. Please, contact our support team on support@herocraft.com to get help. Write in your letter about your problem more detailed, also tell us full model of your mobile device and version of OS installed on it.

content: This is a very good game , with deep tactical brain involvement and also a bit of luck.With a very good story as well!Good job done by the Herocraft team! But there are a few things I recommend to be improve, such as: Need a difficulty setting because some mission are very hard and nearly impossible to get the gold medal. And also in the 2 new scenario mission, we have to be able to buy reinforcement because its very hard (O_o) An achievement system, A new European campaign, and the skirmish mode should contain maps from this game too. Not only from the previous WW2 game. That's it and Hope everyone will enjoy this game! Its so worth it to buy.
replyContent: Thank you for the review! We appreciate your opinion and will bear it in mind for future development.

content: Scenarios are very interesting, and are just the right difficulty to make this incredibly fun! A few extra turns during missions would be helpful, and adding more skirmish maps instead of the ones on the first one would be great (such as maps in Canada, the US, and maybe Siberia would be awesome!) Naval/Ship battles would be awesome too if you somehow incorporate it in. :) Overall, it's a really really great game and has potential to be even better!
replyContent: Thank you for the review! We appreciate your opinion and will bear it in mind for future development.

content: Great game
Comment above!!
This game is the sequel to my other favorite game

The essence of strategy gaming is the core of ST: make moves, attacks, resupply, and then turn. I've experienced a few crashes but that's likely due to my outdated device. Hard to tell if the campaigns are linear or fluid in their outcomes; just finished WW3 as the Soviets and I'm not sure if the conclusion was the only one possible - still, that's minor. The gameplay is smooth and oddly soothing.
replyContent: Thank you for the review, your opinion is very important to us.
